message: When was the Project Gutenberg eBook of Romeo and Juliet first released?
According to the story excerpt, the Project Gutenberg eBook of Romeo and Juliet was first released on November 1, 1998.
How many volunteers are part of the PG Shakespeare Team that created this ebook?
According to the story excerpt, the PG Shakespeare Team consists of about twenty Project Gutenberg volunteers.
Who is Friar Lawrence?
Friar Lawrence is a Franciscan. (From the line "FRIAR LAWRENCE, a Franciscan.")
Why do Sampson and Gregory refuse to carry coals?
Because they would rather draw their swords and fight than be colliers. (From the line "No, for then we should be colliers. I mean, if we be in choler, we'll draw.")
What does Romeo say he will do to the maids in the household?
According to Romeo, he will "cut off their heads" or "their maidenheads".
Why does Romeo say he is a "pretty piece of flesh"?
Romeo says he is a "pretty piece of flesh" because he knows he is attractive and desirable.
Who set this ancient quarrel new abroach?
According to the story, it was Old Montague who set the quarrel new abroach. (Line 3: "Old Montague is come, / And flourishes his blade in spite of me.")
When did the fighting between the Capulets and Montagues begin?

According to the story, the fighting between the Capulets and Montagues began before Prince Escalus arrived. (Line 14: "Three civil brawls, bred of an airy word, / By thee, old Capulet, and Montague, / Have thrice disturb'd the quiet of our streets.")
Why does the speaker's son stay indoors during the day?
He stays indoors during the day because he is "private in his chamber pens himself, / Shuts up his windows, locks fair daylight out / And makes himself an artificial night." (lines 10-12)
Has the speaker's uncle tried to find out what is causing the son's melancholy mood?
Yes, the speaker's uncle has "importun'd him by any means" (line 14), but the son has refused to reveal the cause of his sadness.
